text: Vivid is the first studio album by Living Colour, an American rock band. It was released on May 3, 1988. It was released by Epic Records. Vivid was one of the most popular albums of 1988. It went to number six on the Billboard 200, a music chart. It was certified platinum by the RIAA. A song from the album ("Cult of Personality") won a Grammy Award. Critics liked the album. They said that it was an important part of Black rock music. The album talks about many problems, such as racism. == Track listing == == References == Category:1988 albums
